review: Fun game to play when you've had a long day and just want a fun easy game to play. I love this game and I would definitely recommend!

Pros:
-Animals
-Party
-Funny mechanics
-A bunch of maps/gamemods

Cons:
-Gets repetitive after a short while, a ranked system would help on that
-It's manly a teamwork game and a game to play with friends, playing it solo becomes frustrating after a veeery short while (because you depend on your teammates and also it's not really that fun when you play alone)
-The mechanics are weird and the skill gap can be troublesome (some players are able to throw you half the map and you're barely moving them while they are stunned)

Overall: 7/10, I think it's an 8.5/10 if you have guys to play with and have fun and it would be 9/10 if a ranked system, a little more in depth tutorial, solo maps and more gamemods would be implemented

This can't be compared to gang beasts, while gang beats is a game for friends and only for the fun, it is also overpriced for what it really is. Party animals has a goal, and a UI similar to fall guys, missions, cosmetics, and those graphics are pretty damn good. While some may find the goofy button mashing nature of Gang Beasts more exciting and hilarious, Party Animals is for those who wish to have a 3D "STICKFIGHT: THE GAME" type game but with something to work towards.

Party Animals is an entertaining and competitive game. It's most fun playing with a friend or a group of friends. However, I noticed that some players are very competitive and can sometimes make the light-hearted game less fun. Overall, this is an excellent game for anyone considering purchasing it.

The game was awesome at the beginning, but they managed to ruin it:
1. Due to a low player count, there were instances of imbalanced lobbies with level 100 players facing off against level 10 players. To address this, they increased the hitbox/rate for low-level players and decreased it for high-level players. Despite widespread complaints, no actions have been taken. (I played it on a low-level account, and the hit rate is insane....)
2. After a few months since the game's launch, the in-game currency system is already broken. Most level-up rewards consist of "cookies", which are almost useless because the best skins require real money. A reward cap was implemented a few weeks ago, limiting players to receive max 2 rewards per day. Despite daily forum posts (2-3 every day), they only recently increased the cap to 3 rewards. However, the majority of rewards are still cookies, and the overall quantity has decreased. This means that players have to invest more time but receive fewer rewards.
3. The patch notes doesn't include everything that was changed into the game.

This game is like drunk toddlers running around who don't know how to do anything. The game mechanics don't work very well. You can hit the climb buttons but your drunk toddler will refuse to climb. you can hit the grab button and your drunk toddler will refuse to grab your furry friend to throw off the edge. it can be hilarious yet very infuriating at the same time. Its fun for 15 minutes and then the novelty wears off. Not worth the $20 price point and wish that I could return it and get my money back.

Its a good game and all but, there are some things that aren't good about it. Like for example, the spectating system it has, where people who died/got eliminated can throw bananas, fishes, and even bombs at you as thier dead. It requires little to no skill to win the game since the spectating system can win or lose the game for you. Even if your the best player in the lobby and there's one person left and hes in the middle of drowning (as an example) you can still get hit by a fish and end up losing the game cause of it. There is multiple times where me and my team would've won the game but didn't due to the spectating system. But that is basically the only thing I don't like about this game, besides that. The only thing I would change is the nu chucks since its the most broken item in the game by far. Besides all that, its a fun game most of the time and is well made as well as having a wide range of customisation options that also has many different animals to play as. You are also not forced into using real world money to purchase things in the game, getting in game currency is relatively easy enough so you  don't have to use your real money.

This is a weird comparison to make but I hope it makes sense.

If gang beasts was Friday the 13th then party animals is dead by daylight.

What do I mean? Well one is significantly jankier, has worse graphics, matchmaking and progression but still has insanely fun gameplay with a warmer community and many more interesting ways to interact with the environment and players.

The other is way more polished, has better support from devs and will last a lifetime with a healthy player base but suffers from being too competitive and toxic with a larger focus on team play than just going alone and enjoying a casual experience.

Both have a place and both are extremely fun games which are great for casual playtimes and partying up with friends. But with that said I know which one I like better.

If you like parties, and if you like animals, you'll love Party Animals. This game take the ragdoll death battle concept from Gang Beasts and Human Fall Flat, and inserts it into a fun title with beautiful graphics. This game, Party Animals, is about beating up your friends and foes and tossing about so your the last animal standing. 

I've dabbled in playing Gang Beasts before, but I will say that Party Animals really utilizes the ridiculously high quality graphics and the adorable cuteness of the characters to make it a genuinely hilarious experience whether playing with friends locally or online.

This game also has a bunch of different modes in which to engage in, each with in depth mechanics that make each one unique from the other. One stage has two trains running side by side, here you have to lug coal into your train while making sure the enemy team falls behind. Another stage is set in a winter cabin where you're supposed to toss your opponents outside so they freeze in the cold. There are a bunch of other stages that utilize janky platforming and physics to rid your enemies from this mortal coil.

I've played this games a fair amount of times with friends, online and offline, and it's always a great time. The only thing I'd have to ding the game on is for not being a game I'll play absolutely all the time, but this game achieves what it wants and quite competently if I do say so. 8 out of 10, excellent party game.

Apparently there is intentional input lag... in a game that already suffers from laggy servers that many people complain about (if you're one of the few that doesn't have lag, great for you, but that doesn't change this being the case for most).  This makes the game essentially a random button-mash fest.  Maybe it would still be decent for children who just mash a bunch of buttons and don't use any skill, but for parent-gamers playing along with their children, it is an exercise in frustration, which makes a game with low appeal even less appealing.

However, what really sours this game even further is the recent inclusion of a character from Cult of the Lamb, probably one of the most inappropriate games for children to be playing.  The game developers and/or publishers either don't seem to understand who their target demographic is, or are intentionally trying to shove demonic content in front of children's faces.  Unacceptable.  There are also other characters who can be unlocked after playing the game for some time which have similar demonic appearances.  Yet another increasingly common game that starts off all "cute and kid-friendly" but eventually descends into demonic garbage.

Too bad.  This title had the potential to be a fun little game to play with your kids, but it is ruined by unresponsive controls and the abhorrent inclusion of non-kid-friendly demonic characters.  Money wasted.

Oh, and how could I forget the cash shop... in a paid-for game.

I am a 55 year old biker and trucker father, and probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 15 now. My son got this game for from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 12 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he let me borrow his controller. Me and my son then played in turns and I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my son many happy memories.

This game, is just a joy overall.

It's like Gang Beasts but generally better in almost every way. It's not just a free for all/team brawl, but it's also got different party modes where you have to work together as a team to do different objectives like collecting different candies, moving coal into your own train while trying to stop the other team from putting coal into theirs so your train goes faster, football/soccer, all the goodness. There's a decent amount of maps all with different gimmicks which keep the game fun to play.

A big upcoming upside is that specifically on Steam, you can give a "Friend Pass" to someone, so they can play the game for free with the caveat that they play at the same time as you. Seeing how this is a party game, that's not really much of an issue, and is a feature that more games like this should have as a default. The monetisation of the game is fine since there is nothing that would give you an advantage, just cosmetic stuff. Anything that can be bought in the store, even for the "premium" currency can be earned by exchanging the free earned currency, and at a rate that I've not had any real trouble with.

The game is fun and 100% worth the price. This is a fucking gem of a game, and pretty much any time it's brought up as something to play, it's almost always a yes.

Also! Additional maps are being added and I'm just generally really pleased with the game. I wanna see where it goes. I'll gladly put it up there alongside Ultimate Chicken Horse for a go-to party game! :)

Controls lack precision and it seems they want you to feel drunk the whole time. Bought mainly for my son, thinking it'd be something he could play on my PC, but the controls were too hard for him, and I'm not a huge fan either. Instead of simply climbing a climbable thing, somehow we're grabbing and jumping? The two button climb took a minute to get used to, as the pseudo-drunk animation gives ambiguous feedback to whether you're succeeding. Grabbing and punching lacks precision, similar to a drunk throwing a haymaker. If you're at the age where getting drunk is hilarious, perhaps this is worth it. My son isn't there yet, and I'm not sure I've ever been there.

I hadn't heard about this game until a friend recommended it to me, I had absolutely 0 idea of what the game was about or what I was doing, here's what I'm thinking:

- There's no Battle Pass???
I mean, I don't understand if we're expected to all play with the same super extensive list of character selection? I mean, there's really nothing bringing me back week after week to spend my money on so I'm kinda lost? Do you just get all of it for free?

- MMR is Too Chaotic
The fluctuation between a game that plays like a Sunday drive then an MLG tournament the next gives me an emotional high I haven't experienced since grade school. I think a more defined leveling system will help balance out the playing field, also bots are cracked, valve plz fix. Also, no prestige option???

- My Face Hurts Everytime I Play.
I literally have too much fun that my cheeks are absolutely killing me by the end of the game, my face hurts too.

- There's a LOT of Achievements
I really can't ever choose which ones to focus on or what I should be paying attention to first, I just get really cool stuff all the time. I think this part of the game could be replaced with the battle pass.

That being said, very good game, excited to see if more animal options will be released!

The game could be good, but suffers from the typical problems of online-only multiplayer games.  Every unlockable cosmetic either costs too much of one of the forms of in-game currency, or requires ridiculous amounts of time spent playing to unlock.  The rewards of the leveling system are pathetic for the amount of grinding you have to do to level, and the experience needed to level up increases each time, resulting in diminishing returns.  And if you're not winning every single match, you're barely gaining any experience.  The game feels like a grind.  Not to mention, many of the rewards for leveling up are essentially worthless avatars, avatar frames, or emojis rather than characters or character costumes.  No one cares about unlocking emojis.

The core gameplay is fun but clumsy, and too many characters and costumes are locked behind leveling and the in-game shop.  How is that a good model for a casual family game?  Start being more generous with character and costume unlocks, and come up with some more character designs (try some new species besides cats and dogs; 9 variations of cats/dogs are more than enough).  This game could be brilliant, but it falls short because of the problems above.

developer_response:
Hey there,

Sorry for the inconvenience. We will need your log to further analyze the issue. Please follow the steps below to get the log:

1. Quit game.
2. Right click "Party Animals", then click "Properties". Type "-log" in the "Launch Options", and close the Properties window.
3. Restart the game. Then in Steam Library, right click "Party Animals ", then "Manage", then "browse local files". In the pop-up windows, you will see log files named "2023-xx-xx_xxxxxxxxx-Laptop Name". Each game session will generate one log.
4. Try to reproduce the issue and remember the time when you encounter it. Then quit the game, and ZIP all the log files.

Please go to our website https://support.partyanimals.com/login, and create a ticket with a topic describing the issue, and the time you encounter it. Then attach the zip file to the ticket and click send.

We will get back to you as soon as we find out what's going wrong.

Thank you for supporting Party Animals!

review:
I really do enjoy this game, and don't get me wrong, i love this game to death, but there are some flaws, 
Here is a few that come to mind every single time I play:
 1. Weapons, while the weapons are fun to use when you obtain them and can be useful, they are far too powerful, and I believe they should be weakened in some way since obtaining one on a map that has a small boundary, or ice on the floor is pretty much a guaranteed victory. I also thing the weapons could be more balanced by making them break, or make the player holding the weapon drop it after so much use.
2.  When players die, they get the opportunity to throw items at the players still playing, I feel like this mechanic is a bit to overpowered and unfair. It essentially rewards the worse players, and punishes the more experienced players, I absolutley despise the fact that I could be dominating the match, but them all the dead players target me because, they know I am much more of a threat. WHile in the mean time, another player is picking up a weapon getting ready to launch all the surrounding group off the map, I love this game so much, but these things always manage to get on my nerves, even though these things still bother me I would never not recommend it to people looking to buy it

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Fring flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Fring was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my criminal activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

If anyone knows how to fix the game from constantly freezing please lmk, I've reinstalled it and reset my pc after it's crashed but nothing fixes it. It's getting very frustrating since I really enjoy playing the game
developer_response:
Hi there, thanks for the feedback. Please first try updating the Graphic Driver to the latest version (using clean install). If the issue persists, we appreciate if you could submit a ticket on our website (https://support.partyanimals.com/login). 

We will need your log to further analyze the issue. Please look for the files under this path right after the crash happened (Don't restart your game before you do this, unless it's keeping crashing.): C:\Users\XXX(UserName)\AppData\LocalLow\RecreateGames\PartyAnimals
Find a file named "Player.log". 

If there is a folder named "Crashes". Please zip them all and attach the zip file to the ticket and click send.

We will get back to you as soon as we figure out what's going wrong. Thank you for supporting Party Animals!

Gamemodes: 
Party Animals offers a variety of game modes that are both fun and engaging. From Beat-Up Bridge to Beast Soccer, each mode is unique and provides a different experience. The game also has a Custom Game mode that allows you to create your own game rules and play with your friends.

Skins: 
The game has a wide range of skins that you can unlock by playing the game and completing achievements. The skins are cute and quirky, and they add a lot of personality to the game.

Achievements: 
Party Animals has a total of 95 achievements that you can unlock by playing the game. Each achievement is assigned a reward, including various cosmetic items for the game‚Äôs cute characters. The achievements are well-designed and provide a great incentive to keep playing the game.

General Rating: 
The game is a lot of fun to play, and it‚Äôs perfect for parties or just hanging out with friends. The game modes are engaging, the skins are cute and quirky, and the achievements provide a great incentive to keep playing. The only downside is that the game can get repetitive after a while, but that‚Äôs a minor issue compared to all the fun you‚Äôll have playing it.

Have u ever wanted to release all ur pent up anger and frustrations? Well guess what, now u be an animal of ur choice and scrap with others for a living.
Whether you go full Bruce Lee with nunchuks on others, yeet them into poisonous gas, or drown them, this game has it all!

***Pros***
-The rag doll physics are funny
-Fun game with friends
-Skins aren't entirely locked behind a paywall
-Quick match variety of maps and game modes helps with repeatedly playing without getting boring fast
-Oh, you got insta KO'd after starting a match? Well, u can spectate and throw crap at others for revenge or even out of rage

***Cons***
-Maybe it's just a keyboard/mouse thing, but it sometimes feels like I am inaccurate with landing punches, headbutts, and precision grabs

-Variety of game modes that exist for Quick match do not exist for custom matches, unless I am blind and cannot find the right options (can't tell if this is the case, or if it's due to the 8 player capacity condition)

-Spectating after death is hit or miss with some maps. Some maps give u camera angles that do not view the maps entirety  and these angles make it hard for u to mess with others when tossing throwables

-The reticle for tossing things as spectator is inaccurate bc it doesn't account for throwable physics and environmental interaction. Hopefully this gets changed in the future, maybe an aiming arc is better rather than a reticle?

-Just a nitpick but, it feels like some animals have faster knockdown recovery than others.
Hidden monkey stats.

An excellent game for cute combat with friends or against your fellow server players. The seasonal skins are great to look out for and it is always fun unlocking new characters as you level up. 
Though climbing can take a little bit to master (hold down SPACE+LEFT CLICK+ARROW of direction you want to climb), the rest of the game play is very fun.
Picking up weapons can be difficult also, but just make sure you are standing in front of the weapon facing it (being near a weapon won't make you automatically pick it up), then just hold LEFT CLICK and you should be wielding those nun-chucks in no time!
See you on the battlefield!

[h1]Shared/Split Screen Co-op sucks[/h1]

[h2]Connectivity problems[/h2]

Couch co-op interface is badly integrated. My friends and I tried out the game through Steam Remote Play (I assume it works the same as local co-op) and I haven't experienced such a lack of intuitive design in a while. Local co-op is "technically" online, as you can't play without an internet connection, but surprisingly no online players would ever join my hosted game. Split screen co-op is an absolute joke, we can't even play quick matches or join custom games.

[h2]Split Screen mess[/h2]

The actual splitting of the screen is terrible, a significant part of my monitor is being covered by black bars (yes, I made sure the resolution was correct). Such a simple game should have shared screen instead of split screen (similar to the Moving Out series as the experience was very smooth and pleasant).

[h2]Conclusions[/h2]

The idea of the game is very cute and entertaining but sadly it's not playable with friends unless everybody owns the game (and there goes the whole "Shared/Split Screen Co-op" advertisement). Personally, I don't think it's worth the price, even on sale. Having followed the development of the game since 2020, I am very disappointed and will probably request a refund.

This game is hell. 
Controls are completely inaccurate (I think that's the idea... Somehow) which leads to utmost frustration.
I think it can be an "enjoyable" experience if you are into controls BDSM though.

12 hours in, and I don't think I've ever laughed as much in a game as I have with this one.  It's ridiculous, challenging, hilarious, and engaging.

The biggest challenge is learning the controls, and how the game responds.  It's not as "snappy" as modern FPS's are, and the controls are on the "soft" side, in that you have to anticipate what you want to do and adjust for the wobbly physics.  That said, once you are a couple hours in, it all "clicks" and you will be hard pressed to find a more hilarious and literal laugh out loud game.

Pros:
- Fun and funny almost every round
- Easy to pick up, hard to master
- Lots of fun skins to unlock/earn
- Simple premise, slick interface
- No real thought required, great for blowing off steam
- Ridiculous in how the action plays out
- Good variety in the different levels/mini games

Cons:
- Slow loading times (for how graphically non-intense it is)
- Tutorial leaves out quite a lot such as running rolls, how to swim, etc...
- Replays in sports minigames are time wasters, as well as the winner ceremony (would rather it just jumps into the next game)
- Sometimes inconsistent "grab"/"jump" mechanics where very simple tasks are much harder than they feel like

Overall, truly a wonderful game, easily worth the money, hours of fun here, and with a few tweaks could stand out even more!

Party animals is actually amazing. It's pretty much a improved version of Gang Beasts, and i love it. Party animals does have micro-transactions, but its only to buy skins and doesn't affect the game play at all. You can also get the currency though leveling up, so you're still able to get those skins! The level and game mode designs were really well thought out, and there are plenty of achievements to go along with the levels. The skins are really cute and there are so many of them. I am a 55 year old biker and trucker father, and probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 15 now. My son got this game for from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 12 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he let me borrow his controller. Me and my son then played in turns and I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my son many happy memories.

If this were a martial arts style it would be drunken monkey. If you like  fighting games where you can be hoisted by your own petard , this is it.  The controls feel soft , fuzzy and imprecise, to  the point that if you are of the age to drink they seem to match up with what you are doing nicely :)   Good variety of level types, good visual puns and what looks like ongoing updates for both.  Issues?   For beginners all the sports levels are prone to someone that knows what they are doing scoring  very quickly , e.g,  one hit ice hockey,  Toss of buzzball , but on the whole it appears fair in the most capricious ways  possible.   Great fun,  well worth the asking price,

The game feels crummy to play because theres a significant delay between when you press a button and when something happens. Its also really hard to know if your attacks have landed. It needs some better feedback in those ways. I get its a wobbly physics game, but I've played other games of the genre, Penguin Heist and Wobbly Life specifically, and they do things in a way more responsive and better feeling way. Giving it a negative review, but not returning the game because I think its very fixable and I hope they see this.

The reasons I refunded this game:
1. If you enable local multiplayer (couch coop) then you can't play with others on internet. You are stuck with using the bots, and bots are really bad, they just follow you around and mimic your actions.
2. The split screen implementation is horrible, It leaves a lot of area as black space. I don't know why they didn't implement a single camera system that follows the players dynamically like Gang Beasts.
3. After paying the full price of the game why do I have to spend more money on this scummy Gacha system to unlock basic characters?

Goofy lil game about fluffy animals beating each other in the head with baseball bats.

It's expensive normally, I don't think I'd ever pay $20, but $14? Yeah, sure.

The in-game currency is surprisingly very friendly. There are two currency types, and for the most part you can buy a lot of skins with the main currency you can earn just by playing the game, even the Holiday skins and IP Crossover skins. You can also earn the premium currency from playing the game, not as much as the main currency but still enough to buy a special skin if you save up.

Graphically I think the game looks very good, they get the fluffiness of the animals down pretty well.

The UI is clicky, responsive, and unique. It's not trying to fall into the modern interfaces a lot of other new games have done which I really appreciate.

I like it, if you think you might, give it a try. You can play quite a few quick matches before the 2 hour mark is up, so if you don't like it you have more than enough time for a refund.

The problem with Party Animals is that you can easily get paired with a teammate who actively gets in the way of a win. Maybe that will change later, but for now you can't reliably know whether your team will help or hurt you.

I just finished a match in which my teammate literally went AFK after contributing nothing to our team. If you leave the game, you get a 2 minute ban from playing quickplay again. So the game punishes YOU when your teammate has given up and you leave the game because there's no chance of winning at that point. Pretty cool design flaw.

Also, it seems like some people might be cheating. As weird as that may sound, there have been instances in which players recover too rapidly, make their hits too often, and generally seem to have a "stronger character" than the other players. It could be skill, but it doesn't seem like it to me.

It's still a fun game. However, I don't think I would recommend it unless you go in with friends, and, for me, that means a negative, don't recommend review.

This game started out great but went downhill fast.

Devs kept putting out patches making constant changes to hitreg and how maps work. It isn't consistent and changes constantly which is annoying and doesn't always work properly.

Also, once you reach pass level 100, you can no longer earn Nemo Bucks. They recently only started to offer 2 boxes of cookies a day and you can't earn any higher than that. I'm not sure if my game has glitched but for the past two days, I can't even collect my two box prizes of cookies. I've written in a help ticket but this limitation is irritating especially when level 100 players want to purchase new skins.

This game had potential but the Devs seem confused and don't know how to handle this game properly. For a while they implemented random 4x4 plays but people complained and they were removed. Why not just give us an option for that feature instead of forcing it upon players randomly?

These inconsistent and dumb decisions are destroying the game. They have less people playing now than Among Us. Among Us has been out for years! So that's very telling.

I really wish I could recommend this game but in its current state, I simply can't.

I was really looking forward to the game, after being very happy with how Gang Beasts plays. I figured this was gonna be a direct upgrade, however, it doesn't fill that itch of what Gang Beasts does for me.

The gamemodes are fun. I really enjoyed the alternative party modes like Soccer and hockey and what not.

The main game is bland, again, compared to the Beasts. The levels are way to simple and act more as an arena in contrast to Gang Beasts more plop you in a location type of level design. The game doesn't seem to really benefit being a "realistic physics sim" ragdoll fighter type game. Movement just feels so constricting. I also greatly dislike the camera.

I'm not really looking to convey my thoughts properly in this review, just know that I really won't be playing this again. The game is probably good with a more casual crowd of players, but it really doesn't do it for me.

I actually had high hopes for this game, played and tested it together with a friend but in the end we both had to pass on this one unfortunately. :(
I mean, the graphics and visuals are fine, and the fact that it has microtransactions and overpriced skins, well that's another topic, but what i'm not convinced about are the clunky controls, input lag and poor moderation. Also, multiplayer mode ain't quite balanced at all, like when you start playing as a beginner, you will have to face most of the time against players who spent over 50-100hrs.

The simplest way to explain it, is that if you love the mini games in Mario Party (which is to me the best part of that game) you'll love Party Animals. The game itself is really cute and fun, but even better played with friends. It's nothing to take seriously, it's really just pure chaos at its finest!

Fun, stupid, and overall enjoyable game. Very much like Gang Beasts, another stupid and ragdoll combat game. But one thing that this game has that makes it way better is the fact that, no matter how many times you play a map, it's never boring. And even better, all of the achievements there for you to, well... Achieve! And plus, you get rewarded even stupider and funnier costumes and currency for stupider things! As you can clearly tell, I like funny and stupid things, but I overall think this game is a must buy if you're looking for a fun game to either play with other friends together, or just to have fun while you're bored. Highly recommend purchasing. (Bought during sale)

The characters are cute and the way they move makes it funny. But this game took a very long time to come out. When I first saw it, it looked like an amazing, unique, silly, cute game I couldn't wait to buy. Now, it's just a basic cute family fun game with a little bit of violence. I like the map with the electric ball, and there are a few skins I'd like to get but I don't have the urge to spend any extra money, and only bought the game because it was on sale. I think it's more enjoyable if you have some silly friends or family to play with. Solo, it's kind of toxic. People get mean and will bully someone the entire match so they're dead and can't play at all, and it can get redundant/boring. I can see the game evolving and becoming a staple though.

Red lentil, chickpea & chilli soup

if you're looking for review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding Red lentil, chickpea & chilli soup recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients

2 tsp cumin seeds
large pinch chilli flakes
1 tbsp olive oil
1 red onion, chopped
140g red split lentils
850ml vegetable stock or water
400g can tomatoes, whole or chopped
4 tbsp 0% Greek yogurt, to serve

200g can chickpeas or ¬Ω a can, drained and rinsed (freeze leftovers)

small bunch coriander, roughly chopped (save a few leaves, to serve)

Directions

STEP 1
Heat a large saucepan and dry-fry 2 tsp cumin seeds and a large pinch of chilli flakes for 1 min, or until they start to jump around the pan and release their aromas.

STEP 2
Add 1 tbsp olive oil and 1 chopped red onion, and cook for 5 mins.

STEP 3
Stir in 140g red split lentils, 850ml vegetable stock or water and a 400g can tomatoes, then bring to the boil. Simmer for 15 mins until the lentils have softened.

STEP 4
Whizz the soup with a stick blender or in a food processor until it is a rough pur√©e, pour back into the pan and add a 200g can drained and rinsed chickpeas.

STEP 5
Heat gently, season well and stir in a small bunch of chopped coriander, reserving a few leaves to serve. Finish with 4 tbsp 0% Greek yogurt and extra coriander leaves

I was excited for this type of party / couch game, and first my first few weeks were fun.  But they really could have made some better, more obvious decisions.  I generally don't recommend buying this game, but would play if someone already own it.

For example, you would think it was the perfect game for you to play with your buddies.  But nope.....instead of sharing a big screen, everyone gets a little shitty, frame reducing, box.

You press punch...and it takes .5 seconds for your character to to do something.  I play a lot of games, I am not exaggerating.

You can't type when you are dead!  Why the F not?  That is the only time I can talk.  We are all looking at the same thing, why can't we say something!

The controls (xbox controller) are abnormal as well.  But I suppose you can get used to it after a while.

Every other game I am at least baseline average. This game however, it seems that regardless of the videos I watch, I am in someones face using X without LT, my punches are wet noodles. Jump kick? Wet noodle, X with LT? Wet noodle, headbutt? Their head just wiggles out of the way. I will not be recommending this game to neither my friends are anyone deterred by a game where your input response seems almost random. Could be that they do not have dedicated servers and its all down to Host priority. Which would suck, but do not waste your money on this game until they find a way to level the playing field. It would be hours of frustration in lobbies where one single duo gets 3 stars and everyone else gets instantly tossed off the map, your punches aren't landing, etc.

My opinion, try the game out and see for yourself and get a refund, or simply don't purchase.

Game is silly as the name is. Cute animals, some brute punches, some of the game modes are neat. You don't have a definitive mode, so you just have to choose the map and the map you choose is the game mode. Outfits are cute, way a player dies is funny, it's honestly a great small comp game you can have with your friends. 

On the other hand, wish there was a variety of game modes, not pinned onto one map. Climbing mechanics needs to be vamped, I find myself on the edge of the iceberg for trying to climb for my life for 10 minutes only to die because I ran out of stamina, or finding myself never grabbing on because the character doesn't seem to recognize it's climbable. They added a less recovery time when knocked out recently, which was what I wanted, but sometimes it don't feel like it, kind of inconsistent.

6/10 overall.

"Party Animals" bursts onto the gaming scene as a delightful and uproarious multiplayer brawler that effortlessly combines adorable characters with chaotic and hilarious gameplay. Developed by Recreate Games, this title is a virtual carnival of laughter, offering a perfect blend of simple controls, engaging mechanics, and irresistibly charming visuals.

The game's premise is straightforward: adorable animals engage in fierce battles across various vibrant arenas. What sets "Party Animals" apart is its accessibility. The controls are easy to pick up, allowing players of all skill levels to dive right into the mayhem. Don't let the cute characters fool you‚Äîbeneath their charming exteriors lies a competitive and entertaining experience that keeps players coming back for more.

Visually, "Party Animals" is a feast for the eyes. The character designs are endearing, each with its unique personality, and the arenas are colorful and dynamic. The physics-based interactions add an extra layer of amusement, making every match a spectacle of unpredictable hilarity. The attention to detail in the animations and facial expressions of the characters enhances the overall charm of the game.

The variety of game modes ensures that the fun never gets stale. Whether you're engaged in a free-for-all brawl, team-based matches, or challenging obstacle courses, "Party Animals" constantly surprises with its diverse range of activities. The unpredictability of each match ensures that no two games are alike, keeping players engaged and entertained.

The soundtrack is a perfect complement to the game's lively atmosphere. Energetic and upbeat tunes accompany the action, adding to the overall sense of joy and excitement. The sound effects, from the silly punches to the triumphant cheers, contribute to the immersive and enjoyable experience.

One of the game's standout features is its online multiplayer functionality, allowing players to connect with friends or challenge opponents from around the world. The laughter-inducing chaos translates seamlessly to online play, ensuring that the fun extends beyond local gatherings.

In conclusion, "Party Animals" is a triumph in the realm of multiplayer party games. Its accessible gameplay, charming visuals, and diverse game modes make it an instant hit for players of all ages. Whether you're looking for a casual game night with friends or a lighthearted online competition, "Party Animals" is a must-play that guarantees laughter and entertainment in abundance. It's a testament to the idea that games can be both accessible and riotously fun, and it stands as a shining example in the party game genre.

its a fun game for a few rounds. you cant really play this too long cause its quite basic. you punch other animals and try to survive a map that is minimal different from others. while you're mostly matched with another random player or a friend where you play against 3 other duos, theres also a few maps where its only two teams such as hockey or rugby. in these you just need to drag or punch a ball into the opposite goal. 
most maps need you to stay on a platform and not being thrown off by the other teams so its that simple.
matches last quite long until one team scores 3 wins. 
rewards are very basic too, you dont have customizations, you can unlock additional animals and each have different skins (outfits) or just different colors. you cannot mix outfits together like in headbangers or fall guys.
also keep in mind that the camera view is very close on your avatar, so you dont see the entire arena and theres no way to change it in the settings.
overall its still a fun game, especially when players make use of their microphones.
some people just spam weapons and its annoying but its still a fun game

This game is really fun to play! There are around 20 different map to play and each of them can be divided into two categories, team based maps and duo based maps. The mechanics can be challenging at first but the more you play the game, the better you will become at using the game mechanics. Some of the maps provides weapons which can be used by players to help them win matches. There are also various skins that you can choose from for your player character and many of the skins look really good! In addition there are many rewards in the game that players can achieve when they complete challenges, achievement, or reach a certain level. This is a great game that can be played solo or with friends

incredibly rage-inducing even though it's supposed to be a casual family game. if you don't believe me, you probably haven't seen enough content creators play this game. everything about the game is executed well except for the combat system which is incredibly scuffed and inconsistent. for example, you can only reliably do a heavy punch with the right hook, it almost never does the left hook. i'm not sure if this is keyboard-exclusive, but either way, it makes the heavy punch about as worse as throwing haymakers. there's no settings to change this so it's the left hand instead that does heavy punches, i've searched the game settings several times, and there doesn't seem to be a way to control which hand throws the punch. another example is the grab feature, whether for climbing or for picking up objects. it never picks up reliably, and there's a 50/50 you have to try more than once to pick an object up. for climbing, it's absolutely insufferable; it's an okay feature for most of the maps, except for the ones where climbing is required to be the victor. on top of that, some weapons are nearly impossible to counter and only with a stroke of luck you can best them; there's very little skill involved in countering opponents with weapons because of how awkward the combat and movement is. 

another thing i don't really understand is the inability to have offline matches with ai or LAN. it's a basic feature most combat party games have, but this doesn't. you can make a custom match and the ai has three difficulties, but it has to be online. a waste of bandwidth if you want to play without encountering people targeting you because you are on a hot streak of three matches in a row where your randomly selected teammate is afk for the entirety of the game and only gets kicked in the dying seconds of the game because despite you reporting them as afk, the counter persists at counting down from 30 seconds. if your teammate is afk for any amount of time, you're pretty much crippled, which ruins the fun of the game where you work together to win. 

despite there being microtransactions, i don't see an issue with that being present. the currency you can buy is for buying cosmetics; no weapons or abilities are locked behind anything in this game. that being said, there's a lot of good things about this game, such as the music, the post-match photo, and the maps. the visuals are great too and run surprisingly well. they continue to add more characters and cosmetics, ever since the game was first released. 

a lot of people compare this to gang beasts for its graphics and combat, but i would say because of the additional mechanics in combat that differ it from that game, it has some extra downsides that make me enjoy gang beasts, but not this game. hopefully the combat and movement is adjusted eventually, because it makes the game incredibly unfun for a percentage of people. i encourage you to only purchase this game if you have a lot of friends to play with for custom matches, although the vast majority of achievements are locked behind quick-play(matchmaking) to prevent you from farming them since some unlock rewards. if you're achievement hunting, don't bother unless you want to spend most likely hundreds of hours for completion. if you're wanting to play for pvp, don't bother either, it's less pvp then most combat games because of the lack of control you have over most of your movements.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2023 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

The game was made in Unity. The graphic is good. The game still fun even with this bad hit reg issue also If you thinking about being competitive in this game. You probably wrong, RNG always beat SKILLS.

MULTIPLE GAME MODE
Atleast not every game mode have a goal to Abuse all these animals (KO).
Would say few 4v4 team mode got something unique.

ANIMALS SELECTION VARIETY
There are multiple animal you can select even from starter. Once you progress a while you get more animals in your animal selection screen.

NOT MADE FOR COMPETITIVE (Bad precision)
Due to honky wonky janky Hit detection, Some of your hit won't register the worst case if you were too laggy. The game is very inconsistent with the hit reg and Knock out timing.

ASSIST: JANKY CROSSHAIR.
You can assist your teammate after you were fully Knocked Out. The jank at your crosshair not always aiming at correctly. Sometimes it went far off from your crosshair also even if you successfully/accidently hit someone it just either knocked out or not.

SKINS
You can get skin for free or paid (Microtransaction). I wouldn't recommend you spend $ on Nemo buck if you don't give any Funk about skins. The price is not worth and worst case that 
 Legendary skin almost double the base game price.

MTX (Microtransaction)
Only skins as for now. You can still play all game mode with no extra cost. The skin price is kinda bad especially the Nemo bucks. Nemo buck can acquire from Achievement and Leveling progress. All of these are one time reward once you reach Lv.100 you can't earn more unless buying with the garbage pricing.

GACHA / LOOTBOX
Ony for skins.  Skin for Legendary tier, Epic tier can get through here at rate 1.6%-ish. The Egg coins (Assuming the currency for gacha) use to get randomized skin. There is pity system for this where in every 70-spin if you haven't got any legendary you are guarantee to get 1. while Epic tier will always guarantee at every 10-spins. Oh yeah you can use Nemo Bucks for that too. (Gambling addiction alert)

Way too strong. 
Way too hard to counter. 
Ends every match they spawn in.

My second place gripe - certain game modes are way too inconsistent.
Wind Tunnel is my #1 example. Whether or not someone dies in this mode is purely a dice roll.

Other than those two things... I love this game. Silly, yet somehow a high skill ceiling!

This is a beautiful looking game... 
And it looks like a lot of fun! 

But unfortunately I bought it for offline local / couch play. Like many other people, I was disappointed to discover that the game can only be played with an online connection... and to be honest, it's all a bit finicky. 

I was also disappointed that it can only be played with 4 players locally. I specifically bought it because I loved Gang beasts and A gummy's life, and those both offer 8 player support. I got confused by the description of party animals and the reviews.. as it said 1-8 players. But now I realise that it's only 8 players online. Really disappointed after paying full price for it! : (
I never play it because I have 5-6 players most of the time. So sad!

Even if it did have 8 player local... it's so slow because of the online requirement... loading up local games really is annoying! 

I could only recommend party animals to gamers who only want to play online, and have no intention of playing it with friends locally.

Well... It was long and fun 60+ hours, but after two month from release i cannot recomend this game, and heres why:
1. Microtransactions and eggs. Some skins are available from shop for cookies, some for bucks. And some of them cost a-lot. One skin can cost more then game itself. One skin. ONE SKIN. And some skin, if im not mistaken, only available from eggs - lootboxes.I opened like more then 40 ( no money spend, only from in-game awards + buying some, for the bucks i got as reward ), and got a lot of duplicates ( like 3 or 4 from every 10 ) and 0 legendary skins.
2. Region locked skins. The game have a lack of skins i think. Some characters only have a few. And some skins you can get from out-game reward, like twitch drops, discord nitro etc. And at least once, there was a variant of skin ( color ) only available through chinese site, maybe it was some kind of local twitch alternative, idk. I think thats a bad practice...
3. Content update frequency. Recently, finally, devs give us some kind of roadmap. And said they plan to make a big updates - I didnt not understood what it will be, i mean a lot of content, like skins, maps, weapons etc, or just one thing from each category, like only one map, character, one collab skin, one weapon etc. If second variant - that would be bad. Cause frequency they promise is three month. From release we have a new map, for halloween, one new item and i think that it. For 2 month. And in-game shops, that updating big skins every week are in constant loop for now. Currently collab is Ori skins, and i think i saw it in shops like for 5 times already. Too repeative. 
4. Map perfomance optimization. Some map are ok about that, no problems at all. But on some there a little bit of problem. And one is a big problem - Gator Valley. My GPU is going crazy here, very hot and loud like im playing CP2077 on Ultra, especially in sequences with waves coming. 
5. Hit boxes and registration. From beginning i didnt have problem with that. But after recent updates, it feels like they broke something. Example: I was 1v1, opponent was with nunchucks. I waited for right moment and made jump kick with full stamina on him. And he fell on floor. But he didn't got knocked out. And he hit me with his nunchucks, and im died. And i saw moment like this as spectator quite a lot recently. Didnt happened before.
6? Battlepass. Game have battlepass. With 100 levels, skins, egg coins, bucks etc. And good question. What will be next? With next season. New battlepass would be free? Or, counting that fact that this game have in-game purchases, you would need to buy it? Some more content would be behind the paid-wall, in a premium game.

That leads me to a point, when after 60 hours, for 2 months, with small content updates, this game became boring. Same maps, no new skins, characters. And even fight system feels kinda broken now. I was hoping for this game to be better than that. Sad, cause i had some fun time with this game, but it looks like it's over.

Party Animals is a fun game to play, the animals are obviously the main selling point of the game, they are adorable. The game-play is varied from simple beat 'em up to hockey and train race. Each map has a unique variant to speed up matches, which help with longevity [only in beat 'em up games, so sport games can take forever sometimes]. The in game store is not as predatory as other games, and I've never felt inclined to purchase anything using real world cash. It has a nice balance of in-game currency that you earn and a "rare" currency that you earn doing challenges and through the battle-pass. The game also have a lot of references to things such as Half-Life, Star Wars, and even the movie Cats & Dogs [if it isn't a reference it is a very close coincidence] and it's funny to see them. Overall a good buy and would recommend it for groups of friends to beat each other up in a cute way. 

Now if they allow mod support so people can make their own maps and game-modes, it would make this THE best party game on Steam [in my opinion]. But sadly I doubt it, but imagine a bunch of animals fighting each other on Dust from MW2. Hilarious.

Fantastic party game that brings pure, [spoiler]mostly[/spoiler] light-hearted fun when you play. Shenanigans and brawls ensue in a great variety of game modes ranging from survival ones to team based ones so there's a mode for everyone (although some sort of system to only queue for specific modes in quick play would be nice).

While local couch play is lacking at the time of this review, there are plans to add local split-screen to quick matches instead of just custom lobbies which is definitely a great upcoming feature (which realistically should've been a thing since release but alas) as this game is made for local play! If you're looking for an enjoyable couch game to play while you have internet or are just looking to find some satisfaction in beating up fluffy animals online in good spirit, then the game definitely fulfils this.

Pretty fun little online brawler. Especially fun when queuing up with a friend or playing locally. Main problems as of writing the review: AFK players and skill disparity in the community. AFAIK the developers are trying to update the game to make matchmaking more fair, but chances are if you are a casual player and aren't really into the competitive aspect of the game (especially if solo queuing) you won't have a good time. Toxicity levels are manageable, some players will focus you (again, a much bigger problem when playing solo) but voice chat is mostly harmless in my experience. 

Regarding micro-transactions and skins: if you are putting hours into the game - you won't have to pay a dime for pretty much anything you want. I currently only know about 1 skin pack outright locked behind a paywall. Level rewards are generous and skins that cost normal currency are basically free, especially once you hit level 100. Paid currency drops in decent amounts from level ups, I never had to buy a skin for money and even managed to gift a fairly expensive skin. The issue may become worse (or better, actually) as more content is introduced and additional levels are added (though i'm not aware of developer plans to add more levels atm) 

All in all, if you like competitive online games that are a bit more random Party Animals comes recommended. Queue times are not long right now and the game is not annoyingly random (though this also kinda depends on the map). Skillful players will outmatch luck 90% of the time, i'd say. Bugs are basically non existent, which is also a big plus. What little bugs i've encountered have been more fun than annoying.

First there was Gang Beasts, a new game on PC that had familiar vibes to Super Smash Brothers and such. It was awesome, it was a hit, and then it wasn't. Bugs, slow development, disappointing inconsistencies. I kept playing it.

Watching my kids iPad, I saw "Party Animals", immediately was interested and bought it. Played 4 player local on my computer with my kids and wife, for almost 6 hours straight.

The fighting mechanics make sense, the interface and design is exciting and makes you want to keep playing, the levels and activities that you can do are Mario Party like. 

I can see so much potential in the game, and my kids can't stop talking about it. Solid 10/10 for this game. It is a Gang Beast killer.

Should be a free game, here is why:
-Gamebreaking bugs
-Annoying glitches
-Ingame store with single items priced higher than full game price
-poor optimization (high end graphics card running at 90%)
-virus or crypto miner built in the game ( probably )
-censorship heavy ( word angry is censored )
-ban heavy ( griefing, language use despite the censorship, canceling matchmaking penalty) 
-unstable/ poor server performance ( half a second delay with 20 ping)
-toxic voice chat randoms (there is no punishment for voice chat abuse/harassment, but text messages are all saved and can be used against you)
-AI games, without giving you a choice to leave without penalty as well as hiding the fact that you are playing against AI.
-Who ever made this game should be considered a criminal for his/her crimes against humanity.

Overpriced 5$ max price is fair. glitches vary from game-breaking to mildly annoying. So many glitches its impossible to tell if anyone is cheating. Glitches like stamina either completely drained or not draining at all or death from 1 punch to not dying when you should have. Some instances game will put you in game with AI and not even tell you are playing with an AI. But AI is bad so if you are not as blind as my friends that I bought this game for, you will notice. 
Because of the in-game shop should be a free game. Consider some skins ( pixels ) cost more than the game itself ( more than 18$ for one ingame visual item is a scam) I am not even talking about the poor optimization of the game itself that it needs to use 80% of the high end graphics card to render this basic looking 3D game. I truly suspect it has a crypto miner built in. As well as the unstable connection regarding delay of .5 sec sometimes there and sometimes isn't, while the ping difference is only 10 ms. Most likely the servers are partially peer-to-peer, this would explain occasional broken games with 1 frame per 3 seconds that everyone in the server experiences the same. Censorship in the game is certainly worth a mention. Despite the censorship, week bans are a common occurrence as well.
Conclusion: Game should be free and most likely contains virus/crypto miner.

This game is for a certain type of person, and that person is not me. The controls are purposefully janky as all hell and the camera is also an absolute nightmare (uncertain if that was also intentional). These two things, when combined with the absolute chaos of this game's game play, gives me a whirlwind of motion sickness. Beyond this, there were several other things I disliked about the game that have been covered extensively in other reviews, including a gacha mechanic and paid skins (in a game I already paid $20 for...) and confusing mechanics that aren't clearly explained; for example, sometimes you get knocked out for all of 5 seconds, and other times you get knocked out for what feels like a full minute. 

The terrible controls also just irritated me to no end instead of being amusing. I don't want to grab onto the side of a train when I'm trying to grab coal to feed into the engine. I don't want to spend 45 seconds attempting to pick up a frying pan while dodging arrows, taser bolts, and unicorns diving at me with plungers. Some of the game modes are also insanely annoying and the round-based modes in particular can either be frustratingly short or agonizingly long depending on the skill level of your teammate and opponent. 

I see the appeal of this game, I really do. The graphics are very good, each of the animals is insanely adorable, the music is cute, and there are moments of frenetic chaos that occasionally made me laugh out loud, but this was offset by the constant weariness and groans of frustration I was letting out after losing a match because my teammate and I both got immediately KO'd by a gorilla with a tennis racket, or because I spent 75% of a match dead due to people just spamming grabs and throwing me off the side of a train, or froze to death in the Arctic Ocean because the gimmicky controls and stamina system made me do something I wasn't trying to do instead of climbing to safety. 

If this all sounds like a rip-roaring good time to you, then you'll probably enjoy this game, and I did find it occasionally enjoyable in short spurts; however, the amount of motion sickness and annoyance the game caused me did not give me any desire whatsoever to continue playing it and I ended up refunding it. 

tl;dr - purposefully frustrating controls + (also purposefully?) frustrating camera + annoying game mechanics + annoying middle school boys screaming about Fortnite and fucking my mom + paid skins & gacha mechanics in a $20 game = a game I refunded.

[b]Party Animals: A Delightful Chaos of Furry Friends[/b]

In the realm of party games, where chaos and camaraderie reign supreme, Party Animals emerges as a vibrant and engaging contender. Developed by Recreate Games, Party Animals plunges players into a zany world of adorable animal characters, physics-based mayhem, and a plethora of party-centric game modes.

Design: A Visual Feast for the Eyes

Party Animals embraces a delightful cartoon aesthetic, painting its world with vibrant colors and playful character designs. The animal characters themselves exude a sense of childlike mischief, their exaggerated features and expressive animations adding to the game's overall charm. The environments, ranging from a bustling city park to a neon-lit nightclub, further enhance the game's lighthearted tone, providing an immersive backdrop for the furry brawls that await.

Mechanics: Simplicity Meets Strategic Depth

The core gameplay of Party Animals strikes a delicate balance between simplicity and depth. While the basic moveset ‚Äì punches, kicks, and grabs ‚Äì is easy to grasp, the game's physics-based nature introduces an element of unpredictability that keeps things fresh and exciting. Players must carefully consider their positioning and timing, as even the simplest of actions can result in hilarious and unexpected outcomes.

Layouts: A Stage for Chaotic Shenanigans

Party Animals' diverse selection of arenas provides a perfect stage for the game's chaotic brawls. Some arenas, like the open expanse of the city park, encourage free-for-all mayhem, while others, like the obstacle-laden factory, introduce strategic elements and encourage players to utilize the environment to their advantage.

Overall: A Must-Have for Party Game Enthusiasts

Party Animals delivers a delightful blend of simple yet addictive gameplay, charming character designs, and well-crafted arenas. It's a game that's easy to pick up and play, yet offers enough depth to keep players engaged for hours on end. Whether you're seeking a casual romp with friends or a competitive showdown, Party Animals has something for everyone.

Pros:
* Simple yet addictive gameplay
* Charming cartoon aesthetic and diverse arenas
* Physics-based gameplay adds an element of unpredictability
* Wide variety of game modes to cater to different playstyles

Cons:
* Repetitive gameplay after prolonged periods
* Lag issues can occasionally disrupt multiplayer matches

Recommendation:

Party Animals is a must-have for any party game enthusiast seeking a chaotic and entertaining experience. Its simple yet engaging gameplay, charming aesthetics, and diverse game modes make it a perfect choice for those looking to bring the fun to their next game night. With its ability to evoke laughter and camaraderie among friends, Party Animals stands as a testament to the power of party games to connect and entertain.

Suggestions:
Gameplay:
* Introduce more complex mechanics, such as environmental hazards or power-ups, to add additional layers of depth and strategy.
* Implement a ranking system to foster competition and encourage players to improve their skills.

Content:
* Expand the game's roster of playable characters with unique abilities and personalities.
* Add more maps with diverse themes and layouts to keep the gameplay fresh and engaging.
* Introduce new game modes that challenge players in innovative ways and provide a variety of experiences.

Technical:
* Address any lag or connectivity issues to ensure a smooth and seamless online multiplayer experience.
* Implement cross-platform play to expand the game's player base and facilitate cross-platform matchmaking.

Community Engagement:
* Host regular events and competitions to keep players engaged and attract new ones.
* Actively engage with the community through social media and forums to gather feedback and foster a sense of belonging.

Party Animals is a game where you do not party with animals. You viciously attack one another with your fists, tasers, bats, pans, hammers, and other oddities you can find in the battlefield in order to win victoriously. With that being said, I do enjoy this game for what it offers. The game comes packaged with a variety of animals to choose from (with the only downside being that some animals/skins of animals are region-locked or exclusive to certain events making it unlikely to 100% collect every character there is), a bundle of maps with different modes to fight or cooperate on, and achievements that will keep you invested in the game for the long run. However, this is all offered at the beginning of its a launch. With this, along with a few updates from time-to-time, the game can feel a bit stale here and there. There are also times where fighting does feel a bit RNG, landing hits that have no impact or brushing punches that result in a knockout that stuns you for too long. I highly recommend playing this game with friends in order to have a better experience competing against others either leisurely or competitively. Also Otta is the best animal. Change my mind.

If Gang Beasts and Fall Guys had a beautiful furry baby, this would be it. Fun, better with friends and addictive. In Quick Match, you can vote for 3 options, allowing players to vote for which map/mode to play. There's Last Stand - which is 4 teams of 2 fighting it out, unless you or someone else queues up with 2-3 other people, then it's 2 teams of 4. Once eliminated, players can throw items like bananas and bombs. There's also Team Score - like Beast Soccer and Lollipop Factory, where there are 2 teams of 4. Plus, there's custom games which you can make public or private, tweak the games' settings, and you can add friends in-game. It's very fun especially when you're helping out your team.

Party Animals is a fun game with creative levels and cute characters you can earn through leveling, including additional costumes that can be earned through achievements or the shop as well. So in that sense, there is a lot of variety in which a player can choose and earn through progression.

However there is a lot of unexplained bs I find myself experiencing the longer this game exists and I play it. I'm discovering I mostly experience this on a handful of last stand maps which include Ichiban, Winter Is Coming, Wind Tunnel, and Gator Valley. Ichiban seems to suffer from irregular and varied windows in which the player will be instantly knocked out from a punch or item used by another player. Not to mention it feels I have significantly less time to jump back up out of the gas than others players do, even dying within a second after losing consciousness regardless if I did before I was thrown down there. Winter is Coming is one of the most bs levels I've played given it seems I freeze a lot quicker than others players do at the end game while they can get up instantly or roll back without ever freezing at the end way too often to not be noticed. I see this happen on variety of other levels as well mentioned above at times including a handful of team levels. I don't know if that's due to anything in particular but it's becoming more apparent the longer I own this game.

Because of that alone, I find myself playing this game less and less due to the bs luck people get in general. As mentioned, they are able to wake from knockouts, get back onto ledges, or even roll back into play before timeouts on various levels way quicker than I can. I don't want to hear the "lack of skill" and that kinda crap. I've played this game during Beta over 20 hours including the version from a couple years ago. It wasn't this bad at the start but you notice it more obviously the longer you play, whether a session or playing the game for a number of weeks. I'm seeing a game become less fair in non team games the longer I play this game. Sadly that means it's becoming a crappier product unless it's 4v4 a lot of the time to balance out the unexplained bs.

Would I recommend the games? Yes. However I can't say I tend to have much fun outside of 4v4s with a friend as randoms are insufferable to deal with as your team mates in a 2v2 setting or the fact they expect you to fully carry them.

This game is great for the price. The criticism for overpriced skins and internet issues are minor and can be fleshed out over time. The developers are doing amazing in all other aspects, its incredibly satisfying and goofy to play. The graphics are polished and cute, and there is a great variety of maps and modes to choose from. The shop items can be pricy when costing real money however the free battle pass is a GREAT and rare addition from games nowadays. As long as new maps, modes and characters continue to be released i cant imagine seeing myself not playing this game for time to come. There's not a cuter party game you can find. Don't be discouraged by any negative reviews! Definitely worth a purchase!

So I'd say give this game a go if you like those classic beat-em-up party styledgames.

It's like Gang Beasts but more fun due to the unique power ups that spawn over time. This game also features Team Score & Arcade maps. However, it mainly shines on the Last Stand maps due to how each map changes over time to break stalemates. The controls are more simplistic than Gang Beasts which is both good & bad.

The main issue with this game is the fact it's online only with no offline support. It also features a timed store with loot boxes for anyone who has a problem with fear of missing out. However, there's plenty of base cosmetics through achievements & player levels to not be too much of a concern unless you're a collector or like certain crossovers.

This is a hilarious physics based party game. one of the few where you laugh even when you die.
Plenty of maps with varying objectives, lots of different cute animals to pick from and skins to unlock and customize.
And more maps and animals are promised to come every few months.

While I dislike microtransactions in most paid games, this one does it right. You can unlock a lot of skins for free using the in-game currency by simply playing the game.

It's also one of the few games that reward you for unlocking achievements by giving extra currency or special unique skins for your effort.

Overall a fun casual multiplayer experience.

A great game to play with friends or solo. Its very easy to add other players within the game as friends for party play.

Pros: 

[list]
    [*]Great character design and visual fidelity
    [*]Fitting soundtrack and sound design
    [*]Maps with varied objectives and excellent core gameplay
    [*]Fast matchmaking and nice UI
    [*]Low skill floor/high skill ceiling
[/list] 

Cons:

[list]
    [*]Hitboxes and hit detection seem inconsistent
    [*]Items are moderately imbalanced
    [*]Microtransactions are fairly expensive for a P2P game
    [*]Solo players get matched against premade teams
    [*]AFK detection takes too long
[/list] 

The devs originally advertised you being able to play the game offline and attributed this inaccuracy to a translation error from Chinese to English. The game's current overall rating reflects this dissatisfaction with lack of an offline/local mode reminiscent of traditional party games like Mario Party, Super Smash Bros, and Jackbox.

Overall rating: 7.9/10

Personal View:
1¬∫ -----
I didn't like much the shop, and I still don't like it. I accept the developers need money to keep the updates and servers, but the price of the nemo bucks are too high sadly.
They don't update much the shop, is always the same skins in a loop.

2¬∫-----
When you reach lvl 100 you will only get cookies (the "not valuable" coin of the game), but at that point you can already have all the cookie purchable skins on the shop and the locker, which make them useless. 
Because you don't get any reward when you already have all archivements and all possible skins (without paying more money), It make the game more boring, knowing that no matter if you win or lose, you will not get anything.
The only moment I had to use my cookies where during hallowen event (2 skins on the shop with a price of 18.000 and 25.000 cookies aprox) and the lunar festival (1 skin of 25.000 aprox)
I ocasionally play because I like the game but the lack of new rewards, at least egg coins or nemo bucks, make the game not so exciting. It is good for an hour of fun with friends tho. 
At the moment of this review I have 986K cookies, I hope one day I can do something with them.

3¬∫-----
The gacha machine, Is the worst friendly gacha I ever seen. To use it you need egg coins (a special coin that you only get on events or lvl up between 1-100) or you can use nemo bucks (1200 nemo bucks = 13‚Ç¨ more or less)
You, ofc, will get a lot of common and uncommon rewards instead of epic and legendary, that's normal.
The thing of getting only cookies when you get repeated skins is just **** , you get a useless coin compensation for wasting a "valuable coin" that can cost money. That will make everyone not want to play the horrible gacha machine with money EVER. Bad Strategy. At least give something like a "coin fragment" so people can try again every X tries on the machine.

I never was into D&D or CRPGs. Could be because of the turn based combat, the whole "throw the dice" system that's omnipresent from start to finish, or because I thought that speccing and finding the right build for your character was a massive headache. None of that mattered in the end. These prejudices, these "cons" I had quickly turned into qualities I now seek when choosing my next game to play. I grasped the basics of BG3 during my very first fight and never felt the need to use a single guide (be it for my gear or the gameplay in general.)

Seriously, trust the Metacritic score and the Steam reviews.

Party Animals offers an incredibly enjoyable experience, particularly when shared with friends! The endearing animal assets showcase the developers' meticulous attention to detail, adding a charming touch to the overall gameplay. While the initial price point may be a consideration for some, the engaging content and adorable characters make it a worthwhile investment for those seeking a fun multiplayer experience.

It's important to note that supporting the game financially through the purchase of Nemo-bucks contributes to its ongoing development and the introduction of new skins. However, recognizing the diverse player base, it would be wonderful to see more opportunities for casual and low-budget players to access the full game experience without feeling obligated to spend additional money. Striking a balance between supporting the developers and ensuring inclusivity for players with varying budgets would undoubtedly enhance the overall appeal of Party Animals.

Despite this consideration, the developers have undeniably poured significant effort into creating a captivating environment. The lovable animal assets, which serve as a major draw for players, continue to be a standout feature. As we eagerly anticipate potential improvements, providing a positive review is a great way to express appreciation for the developers' hard work and contribute to the game's thriving community.
