I've waited. A good long while for this game to come out. Played the beta in 2020. Immediately fell in love with the style and a new game to the party brawlers. Waited patiently for 3 more years. Missed the first playtest. Played the next 2, and let me tell you. This game is a mixed bag. I like the game at its core, but everything else is muddied and I dont know how to feel about it. Let me explain. 
[h3] What I liked [/h3] 
[list]

[*] The gameplay. Its fun! It's a TON of fun. Its Gang Beasts meets Fall Guys. Its fun and easy to get into. Theres a lot of powerful items and moves, but the randomness in the physics and the large amount of players. Means theres still a pretty low skill ceiling and approachable to everyone.

[*] The style! Its so cute. Its a very pretty game and the fluffy animals beating the absolute piss out of each others is a fun spectacle.

[*] The maps! While I havent played much of the new maps. The maps that were in the beta. Were fun, unique, had a neat gimmick to them. Theyre well designed and fun to fight in.
[/list]
Unfortunately that's where my positives end and my gripes begin. 
[h3] What I don't Like. [/h3]
[list]
[*] No offline. Yep a game claiming that it has singleplayer and had offline local coop. It in fact. Doesnt. I would say I'm hurt by a company lying. If it werent so ****ing common nowadays. So no local coop unless you got a connection. What a joke. Gang Beasts had that sorted and that game is almost 10 years old now.

[*] Microtransactions. Now I get it. A company has to cover its costs somehow. It still feels grimy that a paid indie game has paid cosmetics and a full fledged shop. When problems exist in the game and they lie about offline coop. I know offline isnt in the game because they worry about you cheating past their store. Thankfully. Its not an entirely bad shop. Currency is earned in game for free by leveling up, and the free currency you earn can be used to unlock decent skins as well. As well as unlocking skins completing challenges. Still tho. With a game like this. Saying "skins for animals" just is weird to me. IMO tho. 

[*] Lootboxes.......****ing really? Pay 120 of your party animal fun bucks or whatever and get a randomized skin. Why? You already have a fortnite item shop. Did you really have to finish it off with that? We left that shit with Battlefront 2. 

[*] The gamemodes. Look. I want to beat the piss out of my fellow animal. Thats it. The other gamemodes are a complete waste on me because, like fall guys. I dont want to team up with strangers that wont do the objective. They want to beat the piss out of their fellow man too. Not play bootleg FIFA or Lucio Ball. They tend to either last 10 seconds as the team stomps the other. Or drags on all the way to the end timer and just isnt fun at all. 

[*] The quit penalty. This game isn't Valorant or CSGO. Why is there a leave penalty when people can join mid match if someone leaves? If someone (like me) doesnt want to play buzzball or soccer for the 2rd or 3th time in a row and want to play the elimination style modes instead.
[/list]
[h3] My suggestions [/h3]
[list] 
[*] Make the Team game modes separate. Fall guys did it so you can queue into those modes. So friends wanting to work with each other. Can. The gamemodes are fun, just not when playing all the time. Separate the game modes and adjust the XP gains to incentives team modes. Or if you dont want to do any of that. Just make it a best of 5. First team to 3 wins. Its that easy. Shortens the length. If you are getting stomped it ends sooner, and close match games can happen much more frequent. I would actually stick around to play them out. 

[*] Remove the quit penalty. Theres no reason for it. There is no rank system at all. We aint competing for the world cup. It'll be of no issue to get rid of it. 

[*] Work on offline ASAP. You told us it would be here on launch. It isn't. That doesn't sit well with anyone. 

[*] Make sure you maintain the currency gained so that people who do put in the time with this game dont feel cheated and the need to buy skins (tho thats exactly what you want isnt it?) I dont think the microtransactions are inherently scummy, but I still hate them in any game.
[/list]
[h3] Closing thoughts [/h3] 
Funnily enough. I enjoy the game. Its fun! Its Fall Guys meets Gang Beasts. The beat em up style gameplay is just fun and chaotic. I will be playing the shit out of this game and I would recommend off the gameplay alone, but with the current issues. I wont at the moment. If you got this far and still decide to get it. All I ask is that you dont support them in their shop. Not until the game is in a better spot and the issues everyone has are addressed.

Thanks for reading!

[h3] Update after one day [/h3]

All my points still stand. Including the leave penalty. The point I forgot to convey was that the game still punishes you. Well before the game starts. So if you see it about to get voted. You just cannot leave w/o punishing. Even tho the game hasnt started and theres still a full minute waiting period that your characters are in a locker room. That should be more than enough time to safely leave a game you dont want to play. That goes for any game mode not just the sports modes. I agree with keeping it after the game has started, but its not needed before.

Apart from the initial server load, which is unfortunately a common thing for games with a popular following, which they seemed to get on top of pretty quickly tbh (reducing queue time from 60 minutes to 10 in less than the 60 minutes to start...luckily I was reading the forums where the dev team updated one of the threads), this is a great game and a LOT of fun. 
The microtransactions seems a little heavy handed, that said you do get all the game and quite a few characters to start so makes sense...I think my issue is with current microtransaction culture in general so not targeted to these guys in particular. And as a multiplayer focused game that requires servers, kind of makes sense. If they keep adding levels for free moving forward I think it works out overall.
I would much prefer the ability to have an offline mode so I could have just got on and played local couch co-op, but if they get on top of the queue times I think this won't matter so much. Not ideal though.
In all, a reasonable start for a game I have been waiting YEARS for, and for the most part met my expectations. A great time for all, and can't wait to play more with friends! The game itself is honestly a near perfect version of this type of game, the style is amazing, and most games are a blast.
Even the logo splash screen was a treat!

[h1] This ain't it chief [/h1]

So, since this game is ripping off Gang Beasts, that is what I will be comparing it to. I am going to not focus so hard on the server issue since it just launched and mainly focus on the objective long-term facts of things that likely are not going to change.

[list]
    [*][b]Terrible optimization[/b], I get it, you look slightly better than Gang Beast but I would rather you not if it means mid-range GPU's can't achieve a solid 60fps. Even the Xbox port can only do 30.  Gang Beast could run on a potato 60fps, this a decent PC will struggle to maintain 60. Overheating issues, extremely common. MINIMUM settings should mean a playable experience. RECOMMENDED settings should mean 60fps. I swear these cash grab developers consider "minimum" to mean hey it launches, and recommended to mean "well it's 30 fps on low settings good enough". By the time you turn down all the settings to get it running at decent FPS (with lots of dips) it already looks way worse than Gang Beast so what was even the point of doing a graphics upgrade if you could not optimize it properly? NO ONE CARES ABOUT REALISTIC FUR WE WANT STABLE FPS
    [*]Ripped off gang beasts, but somehow made the [b]controls terrible[/b]. In Gang Beast you controlled each hand, you could rotate your body around, it was more versatile and felt like there was something to master. Here you just mash buttons, literally, mash buttons get lucky
    [*]A TERRIBLE completely [b]anti-consumer micro transaction model[/b]. You really need to add micro transactions FINE, add some reasonably priced skins. Loot boxes and $30 skin packs? No, just absolutely not. Once again, in Gang Beast you got everything for free after purchasing the game.
    [*]Rounds feel more like [b]complete luck than any skill[/b]. This is a common complaint. I was able to win my first round versus quite a few people by just mashing buttons. The round didn't last long and it didn't feel very exciting or interesting. The controls are so clunky and lacking any sort of mastery that it's just like "OH who will randomly knock someone out first?!"
[/list]

Overall, all you had to do was take Gang Beast, and make it better. You failed miserably by not focusing enough on the optimization, adding greedy anti-consumer micro transactions, making the controls so dumbed down and random (mastering climbing was FUN in Gang Beasts, here you hold two buttons), and taking out the excitement of rounds in Gang Beasts were it felt like were your skill and wit could win rounds, not button mashing.

But hey, at least you ripped off one thing right, you ripped off Gang Beast's terrible servers and somehow even did it worse than them! So congratulations. Don't be surprised if this review doesn't last long, the moderators are deleting negative reviews.

This is the effort of many years of development, so many play tests and you couldn't figure this out? Really? You aren't being "review bombed" your game STINKS.

Refunded. Another 5 years of Gang Beasts til someone can do it right.

edit:
And to ALL the people coping super hard saying "OHHH every game nowadays is online only is unoptimized ,and has terrible micro transactions" [b]YOU[/b] are part of the problem. Gaming does not have to be like this.

The quality of this game is outstanding. From the music being an absolute bop, to the art design and to the huggable animals, it's definitely one of the games to get. There are many game modes to try out which keeps the gameplay fresh, chaotic and fun. The controls are easy to pick up too.

Some quality of life features I would love to see in future patches are OCE servers and offline mode. Just about 200 ping is playable for this type of game. I can still throw punches and get hits with objects on opponents with the delay and even win some games but it could certainly be better. I'm kind of surprised by the lack of offline mode which would be great for on-the-go games. There's no option to quick play with local players on the same system which is a bummer because it'll be fun to go against other players online. You can play locally and with split-screen only in custom lobbies.

It's definitely worth the wait. I'll be looking forward for more content and quality of life patches to keep the game fresh and enjoyable for many years to come!

[h1] Before you buy / Why are people complaining [/h1]
The game is actually really fun if you don't care too much about collecting all the cosmetics.

As to why this game is "always online" and lacks actual local co-op: your guess is as good as mine. Want to have a little fun on the go with your Deck? Nope. You need to use some kind of internet connection. I could guess and say "They don't want people to know how the servers work behind the scenes" but it probably has to do with cosmetics.

Also, there's one "Global Server" for all players. Works fine for me but, again, truly sucks if you just want to play with friends on the couch.

[h2] Cosmetics, item shop and 'lootboxes' [/h2]

If you care about cosmetics, however, you need to know how this game is monetized:
[list]
    [*] Premium currency in a paid game. Not even Fall Guys had this and I knew it was eventually going to be F2P.
    [*] The "Surprise Eggs" mechanic (lootboxes) give you a random skin and can give you duplicate skins. You can use 120 bucks to roll one and get a random skin or a duplicate skin, worth 450 cookies, which is unironically almost worthless.
    [*] You, however, are guaranteed to get cool cosmetics from time to time. Just don't be picky.
[/list]

If you're fine with getting random cosmetics, game on. If you'd planned to be the cool goose with the "Deal With It" glasses, look elsewhere, as those are locked behind Surprise Eggs.

If you only care about having fun from time to time then yeah, this game is for you. Just be aware they might as well make this game F2P at some point in >2 years from now, and they'll probably do a sale.

[strike] And, uhm, yeah, game pass. [/strike] Apparently it's not on PC Game Pass, only Xbox Game Pass. Which adds salt to injury, as some people have regular console Game Pass but not Ultimate (Xbox Live Gold + Game Pass) so they can't play it. Another reason people might give it a thumbs down.

Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ (5/5)
Introduction
In the ever-evolving landscape of video games, it's rare to find a title that truly stands out as a genre-defining masterpiece. Recreate Games has managed to do just that with their latest release. This game is not just amazing; it's a one-of-a-kind experience that sets a new standard for its genre.

Visuals
The first thing that strikes you about this game is its breathtaking visuals. The attention to detail, the lighting, and the textures are all top-notch. It's clear that a lot of effort has gone into making this game a visual spectacle. The graphics are not just good; they're groundbreaking, pushing the boundaries of what's possible in the realm of video game artistry.

Gameplay
As for the gameplay, it's nothing short of exhilarating. The mechanics are smooth, the controls are intuitive, and the game design is innovative. Whether you're a casual gamer or a hardcore fan of this genre, you'll find something to love in the gameplay experience. It's fun, engaging, and offers a level of depth that keeps you coming back for more.

Controversy and Criticism
Despite its brilliance, the game has faced some inexplicable hate online. It's perplexing to see such a well-crafted game receive negative attention, and it almost seems as though rivals are ganging up to tarnish its reputation. However, after spending considerable time with the game, it's hard to understand the basis for these criticisms. The game not only meets but exceeds expectations in every department.

Conclusion
Recreate Games has outdone themselves with this release. It's a game that doesn't just excel in one area; it sets a new benchmark for what games in this genre should aspire to be. If you haven't tried it yet, you're missing out on one of the finest gaming experiences available today. Job well done, Recreate Games.
Love the game's silly physics and characters! Very fun with friends :)

My initial review of this wonderful game was negative because my experience was very undesirable. However, upon gaining more playtime, looking at the developer's responses to feedback, and what other people say, I can confidently change this review to a positive one.

I'm a guy who has waited a long time for a lot of games. Elden Ring, Tears of the Kingdom, Persona 3 Reload, Pikmin 4, Baldur's Gate III, The Thousand-Year Door remake and the like... but I digress. Games aside, I have waited like the rest of you for this release. Sure, this game does have it's issues. There are complaints that certain regions, such as Australia, simply don't have any servers. The community's understanding was that this game would feature both online AND offline multiplayer. However, the developer's have since retracted and edited their statement, saying they have no plans to create an offline mode. I would highly, highly suggest they reconsider. This is an amazing title with a large following who has waited for a very long time- we're here to see it grow, not just stagnate several years down the line when online play is no longer supported.

Sure, some games have a gripping story, beautiful music, and some even the potential to romance intricate characters. Yadda yadda yadda, but can you knock the absolute cr*p out of them like this..? I didn't think so.

[TL;DR] In conclusion, this game is worth your money and your time. I hope that the games offline capabilities and online server availability will continue to grow so that more people can experience it both now and long down the line.

[h1][b]Party Animals: The Ultimate Rage-Inducing Fur Fest![/b][/h1]

Move over, Dark Souls, because Party Animals has taken the crown for infuriating gamers worldwide. Forget dodging fire-breathing dragons or parrying giant swords, try keeping a bunch of chaotic, physics-defying animals under control at a rager of a party. It's like herding cats, but the cats are jacked up on espresso and wielding sledgehammers.

You'll find yourself questioning your life choices as you desperately attempt to guide these party animals through levels that seem designed by a deranged cartoonist with a vendetta against your sanity. You think defeating Ornstein and Smough was hard? Try getting a gang of drunken penguins to cooperate long enough to pass a level without tumbling into an abyss.

And just when you think you've got it all figured out, some maniacal ostrich decides to clothesline you off a ledge, sending you into a fit of rage that not even Artorias at his angriest could match. Forget "Praise the Sun"; you'll be chanting "Curse the Fluff" in no time.

So if you're ready to have your composure shattered faster than a controller hitting the wall, dive into Party Animals and experience a level of fury that'll make even the toughest Dark Souls boss seem like a cuddly teddy bear.

[b]Original Review:[/b] The games got potential, I had well over a few hundred hours on the 2020/recent betas. It's infuriating as a supporter to just be outright forgotten about and then on top of that the community mods trying to silence and ban anyone like myself complaining going to extreme lengths to shut us up.

[b]The reality is we live in 2023. and when you bring a game out and cant even cover the 6 continents in terms of servers then don't expect a positive response. You've essentially shut out half the community that wants to support you.[/b] and the games community mods just ban anyone going against the grain.

The other reality is that this game had perfect servers in 2020 and it seemed that everyone was able to play on their own servers. But somehow within the last 3 years of work on the game. They seem to have taken EVERY server out apart from the US, EU Asia and for some reason a China server.

Without these servers to provide good ping to the surrounding players. The game becomes insanely unplayable, with the already obvious natural delay with characters in this game the ping issue makes this even worse. The experience you get playing on 150+ ping is not the same as playing on 10-100.

Ignoring these countries and continents was a huge drop of the ball and until they have finally added them I cant in good conscience say this is a great game.

If you live in NA or EU. Get the game, enjoy! You have servers. But for everyone else. Sorry you shit outta luck and if you complain you'll get muted the platform you complained on. Have a great day!
developer_response:
Hi there, 

We have already added Australian servers to address the high Ping issues. You should be able to play with low ping in both Quick Match and Custom Game. However, for adding OCE option in the SETTINGS, it will take some time for us to implement it. 

If you still encounter the high ping issue, please go to our website https://support.partyanimals.com/login , and create a ticket with a topic describing the issue, and the time you encounter it and your in-game ID (click on your profile picture located in the bottom right corner and click your ID to copy it). We will look into it. 

Thank you for your patience and support.

Party Animals is a delightful surprise in the world of multiplayer gaming, offering a chaotic and uproarious experience that is certain to be the life of any virtual party. Developed by Recreate Games, this charming brawler brings adorable, yet comically destructive animals into the fray for an experience that's equal parts hilarity and pure, unadulterated fun.

Visually, Party Animals excels with its endearing and colorful art style. The cartoonish animals are irresistibly cute, and the environments are creatively designed, setting the stage for moments of sheer mayhem and laughter. The attention to detail in character animations and the interactive nature of the world adds a layer of charm that will win you over from the start.

What makes Party Animals truly shine is its multiplayer gameplay. The controls are easy to pick up, making it accessible for players of all ages and skill levels. Whether you're engaging in slapstick brawls, competing in mini-games, or forming alliances with friends, the game is at its best when enjoyed in the company of others. It's designed to encourage friendly competition, and the thrill of taking down your pals while laughing together is utterly addictive.

The game's diverse selection of mini-games offers a wide range of experiences, from sumo wrestling to soccer, each presenting its own unique challenge. This variety ensures that no two sessions feel the same, and it keeps the gameplay fresh and exciting, with endless opportunities for memorable moments.

The combination of physics-based controls and interactive environments leads to hilariously unpredictable results. From slipping and sliding on banana peels to tossing opponents into the depths of a meat grinder, Party Animals never stops surprising and entertaining.

While Party Animals primarily shines as a party game, it also provides the option for solo play against AI opponents, ensuring that you can have a good time even when your friends are unavailable.

In conclusion, Party Animals is a wonderful addition to the party game genre, delivering boundless laughter and endless entertainment. Its lovable characters, creative mini-games, and accessible gameplay make it a perfect choice for gatherings, both in-person and online. If you're seeking a delightful and uproarious multiplayer experience that will leave you in stitches, Party Animals is a must-try. Just be prepared for uncontrollable fits of laughter and unforgettable gaming sessions with friends and family.

developer_response:
Hi there,

Our intention with th sentence "Paw it out with your friends both online and offline." was to convey that you can play with your friends remotely (online), or together in the same location using the same device (offline) through split-screen.

We sincerely apologize for any confusion our wording caused. It was never our intention to mislead our player base about the availability of an offline mode.

The game did not feature an offline mode in the recent three rounds of playtesting either. Intentionally misleading our players while conducting playtests that clearly reveal the absence of an offline mode would be nonsensical. (We admit, however, that our description could have been more thoughtfully worded...)

For more information, please refer to the official announcement here:
https://steamcommunity.com/app/1260320/discussions/0/3879344463501273249/

Thank you very much for your understanding and support.

No offline mode.

I am seriously tired of games advertised as having singleplayer and local coop not being playable offline because they need to sell their microtransactions. I was excited for this game but now I couldn't care less.

Literally false advertising:

"Fight your friends as puppies, kittens and other fuzzy creatures in PARTY ANIMALS! Paw it out with your friends both online and **offline**. Interact with the world under our realistic physics engine. Did I mention PUPPIES?"

Edit: 

The devs responded by pointing out that the game was only playable online during closed testing. I have participated in many closed and open alpha and beta tests and can say this is standard in the industry for a game that hasn't released. Studios typically make playtest builds require internet connection so that they can control when players can access a free copy of the game, stress test servers, collect playtesting data, and avoid the game being accessible early through piracy which is completely reasonable for an unreleased game that noone has bought. With that, an online requirement for an early play test of a game in no way says that the game wouldn't be playable offline on release. As an example COD typically requires you to be online when playing the beta tests however every COD on console has offline play. I would have been shocked if any decent size game was playable offline during playtesting.

But the devs expected me to ignore the product description that specifically said the game was playable offline and judge whether or not the game was playable offline on a closed play test I had access to? You guys said the game was playable offline in the product description and have the audacity to say "The game did not feature an offline mode in the recent three rounds of playtesting either."

This lazy attempt at blaming players for trusting their false advertising is ridiculous and "nonsensical."
developer_response:
Hi there,

Our intention with th sentence "Paw it out with your friends both online and offline." was to convey that you can play with your friends remotely (online), or together in the same location using the same device (offline) through split-screen.

We sincerely apologize for any confusion our wording caused. It was never our intention to mislead our player base about the availability of an offline mode.

The game did not feature an offline mode in the recent three rounds of playtesting either. Intentionally misleading our players while conducting playtests that clearly reveal the absence of an offline mode would be nonsensical. (We admit, however, that our description could have been more thoughtfully worded...)

For more information, please refer to the official announcement here:
https://steamcommunity.com/app/1260320/discussions/0/3879344463501273249/

Thank you very much for your understanding and support.

A Wildly Fun Time, But Penguins Are Missing!

Party Animals is an absolute blast! From the moment I picked up my controller, I was immersed in a world of hilarious mayhem and adorable, quirky characters. The game's colorful and whimsical design instantly draws you in, making it impossible not to smile while playing.

The gameplay is simple to pick up but offers a surprising depth of strategy as you tackle various mini-games and challenges. Whether it's teaming up with friends or competing against them, every match is a chaotic carnival of laughter and excitement. The ragdoll physics and unpredictable outcomes of each round keep you on your toes, making every game an unforgettable experience.

The variety of mini-games and maps is impressive, offering hours of entertainment with friends and family. I appreciate the effort the developers put into creating diverse challenges, ensuring that no two games feel the same. The customization options for your furry (or not so furry) friends are a delightful touch, allowing you to make your character truly unique.

However, as much fun as Party Animals is, I can't help but think it's missing one crucial element: penguins! These charismatic birds would be a fantastic addition to the game, adding a whole new layer of chaos and fun to the existing animal roster. I can already imagine the laughs and antics they would bring to the party. Developers, please consider adding penguins in a future update ‚Äì they would be the icing on the cake for this already incredible game.

In conclusion, Party Animals is an absolute riot of a game that will have you and your friends rolling with laughter. While it's already a fantastic experience, the addition of penguins would take it to a whole new level of hilarity. Don't miss out on this fantastic title ‚Äì grab your friends and prepare for some unforgettable party moments!
Needs more penguins, great game

[h1] Do Not Trust The Negative Reviews! [/h1]

[b] People are impatient! [/b]

The game just released and is having server issues which the team is working on.

Everyone is Negative Reviewing because during the first few hours of it's launch they couldn't get into a game.

While the Local Coop reasoning is valid, most of the negative reviews are down right silly.

The game isn't riddled with micro-transactions at all. In fact you get coins every time you level up so you can get the paid outfits. I've already unlocked 20+ outfits and have the achievement to prove it!

After a long time, I'm genuinely having fun with a game. This is a blast, a mix of Fall Guys and Gang Beasts, while still being unique enough to have it's own identity.

I really don't get all the drama, but children need to calm down.
